titles.title: Striped Bass Act of 1994
Striped Bass Act of 1994
To amend the Atlantic Striped Bass Conservation Act, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries.

committee.name: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Fisheries Management.

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended) by Voice Vote.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries. H. Rept. 103-584.
Mr. Studds moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 321.

action.text: Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce.

bill.summary: 7/12/1994--Passed House amended. Striped Bass Act of 1994 - Title I: Amendments to the Atlantic Striped Bass Conservation Act - Amends the Atlantic Striped Bass Conservation Act to extend the authorization of appropriations to carry out such Act through FY 1996. Directs the Atlantic States Marine Fisheries Commission to ensure public participation in the preparation of plans and amendments to plans for the management of Atlantic striped bass. Title II: Amendments to the Anadromous Fish Conservation Act - Amends the Anadromous Fish Conservation Act to extend the authorization of appropriations for studies regarding anadromous stocks of Atlantic striped bass through FY 1997.
